message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with text classification using a new language independent word encoding method. It also involves the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for classification, which is a common technique in natural language processing (NLP) research. 

It could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) as CNNs are a popular machine learning technique and the paper involves the development of a new encoding method for text classification. 

cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is another likely sub-category as text classification is a common task in information retrieval and the paper proposes a new method for this task. 

cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a possible sub-category as the paper involves the use of a neural network for classification, which is a common technique in AI research. 

Finally, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is a possible sub-category as the paper involves the use of a neural network for classification and the development of a new encoding method.
